stories.original_headline: Lab grown human spinal cord heals after injury in major breakthrough
stories.original_summary: Researchers have built a realistic human mini spinal cord in the lab and used it to simulate traumatic injury. stories.fantasy_headline: Alchemists Mend Broken Life-Strands with Dancing Dust!
stories.fantasy_story: The Grand Alchemists' Guild has magically woven miniature life-strands, mimicking the body's vital cords. They simulated grievous wounds upon these strands, observing the decay. But with a potent draught of 'dancing dust,' the severed connections began to mend, promising new hope for the afflicted.

stories.fantasy_headline: New Crystal Reveals Dark Whispers in Blood Early!
stories.fantasy_story: Wizards of the Alchemical Guild have crafted a marvelous crystal that can peer into a drop of blood. It seeks out the faintest whispers of a corrupting essence, long before any blight shows on a scrying glass. This magical art offers a faster way to find sickness.

stories.fantasy_headline: Golemforgers' Scrying Slates Scarce Due to Crystal Shortage!
stories.fantasy_story: The esteemed Golemforgers' Guild has warned that their popular Enchanted Scrying Slates may be hard to find. A scarcity of rare enchanted crystals, vital for the artifacts' memory runes, has slowed production. Many hopeful purchasers will need to wait for new shipments.

stories.original_summary: Apple is starting to test end-to-end encrypted (E2EE) RCS messages with the developer beta of iOS 26.4 released Monday. stories.fantasy_headline: Apple Clan Tests Secure Magical Missives for All Scrying Mirrors!
stories.fantasy_story: The Golden Apple Clan has begun trials for a new protective spell on their enchanted missives. Soon, users of the Apple Clan's Scrying Mirrors and the Green Folk's Whispering Orbs can send messages securely sealed. This magic will hide all words from unwanted eyes.
